website_summaries.verdict: A budget bottle ideal for shorter efforts or as an additional hydration source in addition to a pack or belt for ultra long efforts or in scorching hot weather.
pros: Has an adjustable strap and is available in multiple styles
Features reflective detailing for added visibility in low light
cons: Tough to get the strap back onto the bottle if removed for whatever reason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 3-5 mile runs
customer_reviews.text: Love this little handheld water bottle. Perfect for running, fits my small hand well , doesn't spill, easy to drink out of. No strange smell or taste from bottle. Very nice, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MegR

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle, but all Nathan bottles leak - why cant they fix this!
customer_reviews.text: I really, really, really wish Nathan could cure the issue of the bottle leaking out - the cap cannot be tightened down enough to stop it from leaking. Or perhaps worse, if you clean the top it will soon constantly ooze water, or whatever you have in your water bottle. I love the bottle, the strap, and the size...but I have had three sets of these and finally I cannot tolerate the constant leaking from the crappy cap and bottle combo. Nathan, please wake up and fix this!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Adrian

customer_reviews.title: I love that it's just the right size that it doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a thirsty runner and I have used one of these Nathan hand-held water bottles for almost 10 years now. I love that it's just the right size that it doesn't feel bulky or heavy with just the right amount of water, and the pocket is great to carry keys, money, tiny sunscreen, chapstick, or chews and jelly beans for long runs. I ordered this one as a replacement for one that had been chewed up by an animal and I love the colors. I also have the belt version but I prefer the hand-held for ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Hally Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until strap broke. My husband loved using this in his daily running as it kept him hydrated & it also stored his military ID & room access key without ever losing it again. Stood up to sand and heat of the summer desert climate. He never had one before & was impressed when using it for 5k military runs as it was the perfect amount of water. He wasn't dehydrated anymore after runs. He used it everyday for months in his regular daily run, until the stitching gave finally and the strap came loose. Maybe they have resolved that problem since. If they have, I would totally order it again.
customer_reviews.author: Maddison

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a quick, hot run.
customer_reviews.text: I had an idea to make something like this as I don't like carrying or wearing a bottle of water when I run...too big and sloshy. This is not only just enough volume to keep your mouth from drying out, but the design of the webbing that holds the small bottle positions it out of the way, yet easily accessible. If you like going on 2-6 mile runs, and don't like carrying large volumes of water, this might be a great product for you. I have both the larger and smaller models, but prefer the smaller one for my normal 3.5mile runs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, for a child or very small adult ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, for a child or very small adult hands. I don't have particularly large adult male hands, but I can't get my hand into the grip. I did adjust the handle but by doing so, then I had the high friction of the velcro adjustment against the back of my hand. Quite unfortunate, because the actual size of this bottle is EXACTLY what I was looking for in a compact, low volume water companion for my runs. Will be returning this. I suppose my only option is a higher capacity bottle, just so the handle will fit in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend !
customer_reviews.text: I got this just in time for my 5 mile race last week and it is so inventive! It felt comfortable in my small palm and I even had light gloves on (we live in Wisconsin and the temperature was 32!). I appreciate the zippered compartment for keys and chapstick. Having it saved me a stop at the water station and guzzling water hastily. The nipple design is ingenious and allowed me to take small sips when needed without putting a cap on and off. Really cool!
customer_reviews.author: rebus

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the right amount
customer_reviews.text: As I am not a fan of carrying items in my hands while running, I postponed getting a carrying bottle for long runs for months... but after trying a clip-on bottle for a belt, I knew the weight and rub weren't for me. So I tried this - and it's perfect. Just 4 oz is all I need for 90-120 minute runs and I am technically not holding the bottle unless I'm drinking from it. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Good for runs outside
customer_reviews.text: The bottle is small but it is perfect for moderate runs from 8-10ish miles. I tend not to drink too much water while running so it is perfect for me to take a few quick sips when needed. The pouch can hold several gels, car keys, etc, and the strap fits comfortably in my hand. If you are planning to run longer than 12 miles I'd recommend a bigger bottle.
customer_reviews.author: G. Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit - didn't leak.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable fit for me (5'7" woman) with regular sized hands as well as being adjustable and a great fit for my young daughters (4'8") with children's hands. No issues with leaking as reported by other users. The zip front section (which is well described in the seller description) is fine for a folded bill or two, one key (but not a whole key chain or large bundle of car keys). Just the right amount of hydration for a short 5km run on a cloudy 75 degree day. Wouldn't expect it to be enough for a longer stint or hotter conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Suelee

customer_reviews.title: For me this product is an investment
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this in 2018 before my 5K marathon. But I have been using this more for hiking these days. It is perfect when you don’t want to carry a big bottle in your hand or have a hassle of taking the bottle out every now and then. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: sxb

customer_reviews.title: One of the smart purchases a runner needs to think on
customer_reviews.text: I think that its capacity is ok for medium to short distances, and for its size and weight does not bothers when running a medium long distance like 15 km. The internal bag / storage helps in carrying additional energy bar or jelly to keep the beat and pace through the training without getting in the way. The additional reflective strip gives additional protection to the user
customer_reviews.author: Frank Bruce Cuadra

customer_reviews.title: Great for short runs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light weight water bottle with a big zippered pocket for storage. The 10oz is great for runs of 7 miles or shorter (for me). The only issue that I have is that it is tight for my sized hand and when adjusted to the biggest the Velcro did irritate my hand a bit - nothing big and I can live with it. All and all I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to Nathan mouth pieces & choose accordingly.
customer_reviews.text: If you like this type of top, this will work out great for you. If this is the first hand held for you, let me point out the different tops. Some have a wider rubber mouth that’s more comfortable to me. This top hit my teeth while running. It may be personal preference but I didn’t love this one. I returned it for the other type mouth piece.
customer_reviews.author: debi

customer_reviews.title: Great even for larger hands!
customer_reviews.text: I really love the size! Its perfect for my 5k or so runs. The hand hold is nice and snug, a little difficult to switch hands but I'd rather it be snug than loose. Even when sweaty it does not slide around and so far no skin abrasion. I have larger hands for a woman and its still a good fit, in case you have larger hands and are on the fence about it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: While I think this is perfect bottle to carry on a short hike or long walk, there is no way you can fit a phone in the pouch. OK maybe a flip phone but my Iphone 6S certainly doesn't fit . You do have to make sure the top is on and tightened completely or otherwise you will find it will leak. I only gave it 4 stars because I felt is was misleading on carrying a phone.
customer_reviews.author: mark brazell

customer_reviews.title: Solid option for casual running
customer_reviews.text: I run 3 miles 4x a week or so. I've noticed this bottle is good up until this point. Once I hit 3 miles the 10oz isnt enough. I wish I wouldve gotten the bigger size. The only other con would be the hand strap. The strap is too small for most medium to large hands. Other than this, the bottle has been quite the lifesaver for me.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: It’s exactly what I was looking for. I already own running belt (?) that has a zipper to hold phone/keys/etc and pockets to hold waters. I don’t like having something around my waist while running so I was on the search for something more lightweight yet functional. This flask fits the bill. I took one star off bc I’m on the petite side and wished I could make it a little tighter around my hand.
customer_reviews.author: M.M.S.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Water Bottle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because one of my friends had one and loved it. For a first timer running with a water bottle this is perfect. I had to figure out how to take the bottle out of the holder, which can be a pain, but I got it. One thing about it being Velcro is that I have to adjust it once I start running and it gets sweaty, otherwise I highly recommend this product if you are just starting out training to run with a water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: N. Winter

customer_reviews.title: Good bottle but not for large hands.
customer_reviews.text: Great bottle to keep energy up during shorter runs. I use Gatorade powder and water to get quick carbs (energy) on 3-5 mile long runs or for sprint intervals. The strap is pretty tight though so if you have large hands you may want to get a larger version which I believe they make.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: GREAT - Perfect size - doesn't leak!
customer_reviews.text: For you who say it leaks - screw on the lid the right way! Just watch the threads and make sure it lines up. Doesn't smell like chemical because it's made in the USA (Chinese bottles do). Perfect size for runs up to 10 miles or shorter. Will buy again - and I will - a bigger one for half marathon.
customer_reviews.author: range dog

customer_reviews.title: A few quirks, overall does a good job
customer_reviews.text: The people reporting that it leaks are right. It does. But it's not that bad. The other issue I have found is that if you put electrolyte tabs in it the pressure from the fizz makes it shoot shirting streams. So you have to leave the cap off for a few minutes. Other than that, its a nice little water bottle. It feels great in my hand and I don't have to grip it. It is easy to adjust on the run also. I prefer it to waist packs. The pouch is nice sized and easy to open and close on the run.
customer_reviews.author: taytaydoggirl

customer_reviews.title: small
customer_reviews.text: Good for a short run but anything over 3 miles you'll need a refill. great fit for my small hand and I love the color
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Brown

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The worst running water bottle I have ever purchased. I'm not sure what Nathan changed for this design, but the last Nathan running water bottle (gray) I had lasted for 8 years until I fell and destroyed it. I bought this pink/teal one to replace the old one a few months ago... and have wanted to throw it into the street every time I run. It LEAKS while you run... when you squeeze it to take a drink... leaks in your gym bag. Just don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: EJD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't used to running with a water bottle, but per a recommendation from a friend I tried it out. I am very happy with the purchase. This is the perfect size for a short to middle distance run for a quick shot of hydration to keep you fresh. For longer runs I would recommend re-filling when able. I got used to it very quickly. I wasn't used to running with anything in my hands. The pocket on the outside is perfect for a little nutrition, salt tabs, or your keys.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: For petite hands only.
customer_reviews.text: Asa female, I have average hands and the water bottle is not comfortable on the hand as it’s intended to be held. Maybe it’s meant for petite hands or maybe it’ll stretch eventually, but for now it cuts off circulation to my thumb. Probably would just buy the bigger one if I had to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R. Ledford

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but I wish it were a little smaller.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It does what a water bottle does. For some reason I was surprised by the size. I wish it were a bit smaller. But it still works fine for me. If you have tiny hands, it will not fit in your palm, like you might expect. Probably perfect for a man, since they have bigger hands. It’s nice not having to open and close a cap, when you have sweaty hands. I like the pouch too; great for keys, mace, whatever you might take walking/running. If you have a flip-phone, those fit in there perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Reba

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife happy life.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my wife and she loves it. She had a similar one that broke because the bottle stretched the strap each time she put the two together. This one expands to allow the bottle to go in with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Can't Drop This One!
customer_reviews.text: The comfortable glove-like strap leaves hands free for other tasks, and makes dropping your water bottle impossible. The zippered pouch has an inner pocket the perfect size for I.D. and credit cards, and the pouch itself is a great size for keys -- even newer oversized electronic ones. I was skeptical of the quick-refill feature, but it's easy to use, even while running. 10 oz size is lightweight and can work well even on longer runs / rides because of the easy-refill feature.
customer_reviews.author: P. Boles

customer_reviews.title: No Leaking, Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what some of the other reviewers were complaining about. This flask does not leak at all if the lid is on correctly. I've used it daily for a year and it's still as good as new. It holds just enough water for a five mile run and fits comfortably on my hand. I'm going to buy a second one so I have a back up!
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get used to it
customer_reviews.text: My friend runs with one of these and loves it, but I just couldn't get used to it. I also found it difficult to clean and held frustratingly little water. I could see using this for a 3ish mile run, but anything longer I would need more water.
customer_reviews.author: S.A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Tri
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my first triathlon sprint. It worked great and comfortably strapped to my hand. The little pocket was great for some gems that I placed in there. Only thing it had a chemically smell. I would make sure to throughly was prior to using.
customer_reviews.author: Kiya

customer_reviews.title: Great little water bottle!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like to run with stuff but this is the perfect little thing to help stay hydrated when running 6-12 miles. I can also keep my house key and a couple bloks in the little zipper. It leaks a little bit when it’s full all the way but it never full all the way for very long. It has definitely helped me last longer while running.
customer_reviews.author: FGC0429

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a race last weekend and by the time I got off the bus at the starting line, this and everything in else in my bag was wet (including my ibuprofen and electrolyte pills--wet pills are a mess). Not to mention starting the race with something soaking wet on my hand was annoying. I thought I could trust this brand not to leak but I suppose not, and for some reason I can't even return or replace it! Extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light on hydration, but handy
customer_reviews.text: I signed up for a learn to run a 5K course. Hydration is drilled into you, so I thought this would be handy. Pros: Compact, lightweight, and the pocket is a good size for necessities such as ID, car key/fob, and a tube of chapstick. Cons: Not enough hydration for really hot running days, the cap doesn't have quite enough threading on it to stay tight and avoid spillage, and I have small hands, so I think eventually the handle will stretch too much without enough adjustment to keep it snug on my hand. The handle/pocket combo is difficult to take off and put back on in order to clean the bottle well without getting the whole thing wet.
customer_reviews.author: MM Shears

customer_reviews.title: Great running bottle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for running in the summer. I needed a water bottle on my runs and a place to put my car key fob and license. This works great for that. It fits nicely in my hand and doesn't feel like I am holding something. It doesn't leak or spill. It is easy to fill and clean. The one thing I plan on doing in the future is trying to freeze it. The water otherwise warms up in your hand and isn't as refreshing as a nice glass of cold water.
customer_reviews.author: LisaMB

customer_reviews.title: Just The Right Size
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned this would not be enough water but it turns out to be just fine. I briskly walk 40 mins a day outside and it's hot and humid where I live. I am 5'6" 180 lbs Age 64.
customer_reviews.author: Jim O.

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: Got this water bottle as I will be running in a Ragnar soon and wanted something small that would allow me to carry water. The straps on the one I received are not like the ones in the photo that show the opposite side of the pouch. It was also a little confusing how to get it to fit my hand. After looking at the design, I figured it out and it shouldn't be too bad. However, we shall see how it holds up during the race. Overall, a decent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L.

customer_reviews.title: Would be better for shorter distances where you are only concerned about ...
customer_reviews.text: Just used this on my first half marathon and it worked well! Managed to cram my ID, my car key, and 4 energy gels in the small zipper pouch, but that was with forcing the zipper closed. Would be better for shorter distances where you are only concerned about carrying a car key, house keys, and maybe some chapstick.
customer_reviews.author: kmz91

customer_reviews.title: It’s OK
customer_reviews.text: Isn’t really hand shaped but this could be because I have small hands. Kind of difficult to get water out of. Does not allow you to drink, just shoot water into your mouth, sometimes a little too quickly. Choked on some water the first time I used it. Pouch is nice and handy for carrying keys while I run.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: This works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something for hydration as I train for a 10k (with a half marathon down the road). This fit the bill perfectly. It holds enough water (about 8-10 oz) to satisfy me on 6-7 mile runs. The pouch will hold a car key easily. It will also hold the Clif Blocks I chew mid-run during the longer sessions. Easy to drink from and fits in my hand quite comfortably. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Boone

customer_reviews.title: Fun color
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a woman in her 70's I chat with while walking. Told her she should carry water so I surprised her with this Nathan and hung it on her car mirror!!!
customer_reviews.author: michelle king

customer_reviews.title: Great except one major thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this product... the only reason for reduced stars is because after washing the bottle many times plus soaking it in water and baking soda, it still gives the water a weird taste... almost unpalatable.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Porterfield

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to order this after reading reviews about leaking but ultimately ordered it out of desperation! I'm so glad I did! I'm happy to report zero leaking after multIple uses. I find it holds just enough fluid to keep me adequately hydrated for runs up to six miles. The storage is enough for your car key and ID. Also, I don't fill this all the way to the top with water. I leave about an inch or so of clearance. Maybe this is why I haven't experienced the leaking others have reported.
customer_reviews.author: KymS

customer_reviews.title: A nice little bottle to carry around as I run
customer_reviews.text: A nice little bottle to carry around as I run. Not too big to make me lopsided. The lid has to be put on properly, otherwise it will leak, but a simple adjustment fixes that before setting out. I mainly got this for the zippered pocket because sometimes as I ran, my keys would fall out onto the trail (I always recovered them, but the turning back to grab them was annoying), but as summer hit, I really appreciated the water aspect as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: I do like the pouch
customer_reviews.text: I use this quite a lot. I wouldn't suggest it for long runs or walks however because it doesn't hold enough liquid. I am usually out before I am finished with my walks. I do like the pouch. It holds my keys and cards nicely.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cottom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for runners!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first running water bottle and I love it! I have since purchased other Nathan water bottles. This bottle is perfect my runs under 6 or 7 miles. The pocket is big enough to carry keys and ID, and it fits perfect on my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little handheld, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a handheld for my 8 year old son that could fit his hand and still provide an adequate amount of water. This bottle works great and he loves the look of it. The only issues are that it can sometimes leak a bit if turned upside down, and the top is tricky to get on just right because the cover can get in the way. Overall, happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea F.

customer_reviews.title: Good for short to mid distance runs
customer_reviews.text: This is great for short to mid distance runs, and I didn’t have any problems with leaking. I personally don’t love how the pouch obstructs my grip on the bottle, especially since I find the pouch mostly unnecessary, but You get used to it
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: Ehh. Good idea, bad design
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this bottle and the idea of the ergonomic handle but you can't really hold it comfortably. It goes so close to your wrist and sits on your hand pad (is that a thing? Hopefully you get what I'm saying), that it just feels like it's constantly about to fall out of your hand.
customer_reviews.author: drin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Got it to use on long runs and summer runs to stay hydrated. It holds about 9oz of water. The zippered pocket is the perfect size for a card, key, cash, or headphones. (Pocket is not waterproof though.) It’s high quality and durable. The strap is Velcro and adjustable so you can tighten or loosen it to fit your hand.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Nice for short runs
customer_reviews.text: This little water bottle fits nicely in your hand and you don’t have to worry about it falling while running. The front pocket has a little back section for keys and you can fit gels or something small in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a runner!
customer_reviews.text: This little bottle is awesome to run with! The colors are cute and it’s easy to clean. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: SugarSweet

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: This water bottle holds a surprising amount of water, and the pouch is large enough to hold my mid-run fuel (snacks). The hand strap is adjustable and fit well in my bare hand as well as over top of thick gloves. I have worn it on both hands and it fits comfortably in both. The cap does not leak, however it is a bit tricky to get it on tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: You don’t even know your carrying it
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The strap fits snug and you don’t even have to grasp it. Water squirts with suction from you mouth. Works great. Zip pouch good size for keys or cash/credit card.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable. I hate carrying large water bottles so I ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and comfortable. I hate carrying large water bottles so I prefer a smaller one that I can refill at water fountains along my running routes. Fits tightly on your hand so you barely even know you are carrying it. The pocket is pretty small and will not hold more than keys and maybe a gel or two.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Easy run!
customer_reviews.text: This is such an amazing product!!!! One of my Amazon best buys for sure. I had such an easy run, i didn’t have to worry about my holding my water, it fits just right. I have a place for my car key and ID as well and not have to put it in my clothing pockets. Love!!’
customer_reviews.author: EBD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Great product for avid, long-distance runners that don't want to carry a full-length bottle due to weight, etc.
customer_reviews.author: UbergeekT

customer_reviews.title: Pin hole leak in the bottle
customer_reviews.text: The bottle developed a pin hole leak after 3 months of use. I only hand washed the bottle. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah VR

customer_reviews.title: Great lil bottle.
customer_reviews.text: Great lil bottle for a 5k run. I’m unsure how to take the zip pouch off when it needs to be washed.
customer_reviews.author: joycelyn10

customer_reviews.title: Breaks in a couple of months.
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this I thought it did what I needed it to do--- hold enough water for shorter runs on hot days. It fulfilled its purpose. I didn't even mind I couldn't remove the pouch on the bottle to clean. However, I purchased this mid-June 2015 and it is now mid-September 2015, and the last few times I've taken it with me on my runs, the water leaks and is on my car floor/cup holder/etc. before we arrive at the place to run. It's now in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: COG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is surprisingly soft. The water flowed easily from the spout (it's a rubber "X" valve inside the lid - so no need to open or close a cap, hooray!). The container didn't drip or leak while running (I used it for a 10k race today). The pouch easily held my ID, credit card, cash & car key.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: I like the cute color scheme of course
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient, I like the cute color scheme of course, and it holds enough water to keep me reasonably hydrated on a 4-5 mile run...but i feel like the bottle design could use a little work. It's not as easy to squeeze as I would like (that's what she said). It's important to be able to get that fluid into your mouth very easily when you're on the go.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great little water bottle with room for gel.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my semi long runs. Usually have to fill up halfway, but I don't mind that.
customer_reviews.author: Li Anne Kern

customer_reviews.title: Smaller hands work best...
customer_reviews.text: If you have cold water, your hand will be chilled for your run. Other then that, it is for people with smaller hands, like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Wassmund

customer_reviews.title: Too bad...
customer_reviews.text: Initially this product was good. Perfect size for shorter runs or races. Only had minor leaking issues and liked the zippered pouch for gels, keys, etc.. After a few hand washes it started having major leaking issues. All of the water would be gone by mile 3 and my shorts soaked. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Deezy85

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: Pro: a great size for shorter runs, and the pouch is good for a key and a Gu Con: it leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Joohyun Park

customer_reviews.title: A must have for runners!!
customer_reviews.text: I carry this with me every single time I run. It's easy to hold and easy to drink from - both very important features while running. I can't think about if I'm going to drop something, if something is heavy or annoying in my hands, opening or closing a water bottle. This is very well designed. The pocket is not large enough for a phone, but it holds the key fob for my car and could hold a little cash or ID too.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a shorter distance run in the hot weather. It’s on your hand very well I can go on both the left and right hands
customer_reviews.author: Rich Brueckner

customer_reviews.title: Answer to thirst issues on the run
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy piece for training or on race day. It is light weight and really rests on your thumb without pulling or constricting movement. I have had carpal tunnel issues and this does not create any discomfort for me. I'm glad I made this purchase and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Doesn't leak. Comfortable hand strap and the pocket holds what I need it to. Hold enough water for shorter runs. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for shorter runs
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for my 5 mile runs on hot days. My water is always pretty hot halfway through (and I put ice in it) but that’s not too much of an issue. I didn’t have any trouble with it leaking either, and I turn it all different ways when I run!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Nice running bottle
customer_reviews.text: The color wasn’t what I thought it would be. More blue than purple but it works well. It was a little tight on my hand at first but it stretches. There is a little pocket attached. I haven’t used it yet though. Don’t want to make it too heavy. Easy to drink out of while running.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

customer_reviews.title: smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: The pocket isn't very large. I was hoping to fit my phone, but not sure it will even hold my car key.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: great for running short distance
customer_reviews.text: i have been using this regularly for 5-8 miles runs for the past 6 months and i love it. light and easy to grab.
customer_reviews.author: Arash

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Fit and comfort are great however the bottle progressively leaked worse with each use. I couldn't complete a mile without the bottle emptying on me
customer_reviews.author: J Rock

customer_reviews.title: handy running mate
customer_reviews.text: my son (who runs cross country) and I love the size of this flask. It is perfect for a 10-15 mile run, IF your not a guzzler. If you are a sipper when you run then the size will probably work well. the thumb actually is supposed to slip into the sleeve and come out behind the cap of the bottle. When you position you hand with the thumb in the center behind the cap, you do not even have to hold the bottle, it will stay nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Liisa Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great water bottle for short runs
customer_reviews.text: Great water bottle for short runs. The bottle design and hand strap fit securely and comfortably, making for a natural, unencumbered feel. To drink, you squeeze the bottle and water comes out fairly easily. (If it is completely full, it splashes out a bit, and it's difficult to get the last half inch or so out.) The pouch is a good size for a card or keys, but is not meant for a phone.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: I don't love running with anything in my hands
customer_reviews.text: I don't love running with anything in my hands, but this is small and you don't really have to hold on to it. I still find it to be a distraction, but that is a personal thing. I prefer my nathan running/ water belt, but for shorter runs especially in summer heat and humidity, this is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: SB2013

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Bottle
customer_reviews.text: This handheld water bottle is great! My only small complaint is when putting cold water in it, you feel it through the bottle which makes my hands cold when running in the early mornings...but that's something I've gotten used to. I love the fact that there's no drips and I like the little compartment it has. I keep my gate card in it when running in my neighborhood... I'm pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: CiCiStarr

customer_reviews.title: I like this water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I like this water bottle, it's a nice size, but it has a few issues. It does leak sometimes if you overfill it, which can be a hassle, and also the velcro strap is often loose/unfitted to your hand no matter how tight you make it. The storage pack is a nice size. It works but I might try something different next time.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Bottle/Wrap AWESOME! Cap, STINKS
customer_reviews.text: I love this bottle and it's wrap! The wrap fits for my hand size a lot better than the Amphipod I purchased a while back. The only complaint I do have is the cap. The cap that is on this bottle is not conducive to running in any nature. When running or walking with this style of cap, you WILL splash yourself. I had to hold my arms stiff in order for it not to leak. It was awful. The bottle and wrap are awesome but, the cap on this sucks.
customer_reviews.author: J.Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: My first handheld and love it
customer_reviews.text: My first handheld and love it & great for shorter than 10 mile runs
customer_reviews.author: Erica Crain

customer_reviews.title: Great for cardio
customer_reviews.text: Works great for runs and walks. However, Bottles begin to crack in a couple months, causing the bottle to leak. I have not been able to find just the bottle. Therefore must purchase a whole new set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for running, a little awkward to hold though.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this water bottle several times and have no issues about drinking out of it. My only issue is the band is so wide it's difficult to hold while running. I only use it for long runs so it doesn't bother me. The seller sent it quickly and packaging was excellent. I would use this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!  Perfect for running
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! I used it during my first half marathon and worked just as expected. I was able to fit some pretzels in the pouch, as well as chopped up pieces of granola bar. I made my own "Gatorade" as I didn't want to drink the sugary stuff they hand out during the run. It seems small but it was actually the perfect size for me. It also didn't bother my arm or hand while running.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Molina

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Like Crazy!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great size, fits my hand perfectly and I like the zippered pocket for my chews. However, this bottle leaks like crazy!! It doesn't leak from the part where you drink out of, it's like the seal of the cap to the bottle isn't made very well and it leaks from there. I drank my liquid far faster than I would have just so I wouldn't waste it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small bottle!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for runs between 7 and 15 miles. It’s small and doesn’t weigh me down or disrupt my strides. The spout is also super easy to drink from while running! You just squeeze the bottle and water shoots into your mouth. It reminds me of the Gatoraid bottles we used in high school but obviously way easier to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Kaely Mills

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my runs stays on hand and very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight handheld
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, easy to carry, easy to hold. This is the perfect handheld for a quick 4 miles around the block. Lightweight and easy to clean and fill. Bottle comes off holder and can go in the dishwasher. Pocket is a generous size to hold keys, money, even an inhaler if needed.
customer_reviews.author: PhilPhan Em

customer_reviews.title: The hand strap isn't as comfortable as on the larger bottles
customer_reviews.text: This flask was mostly what I was looking for. The hand strap isn't as comfortable as on the larger bottles, but it's great for short runs in hot/humid weather. I can fit an ID and a gel in the pocket if needed, but definitely not a phone or anything larger than a typical driver's license.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: This water bottle works well for that easy short run or walk. Its design makes it easy to carry and with the thumb holder I can relax my grip without the holder slipping and dropping my bottle. The larger bottles also have a great design.
customer_reviews.author: Felix G. Lugo

customer_reviews.title: I love Nathan products
customer_reviews.text: I love Nathan products! I bought this to replace an old Nathan I had. Great for short runs and for holding small snacks like fruit snacks and jelly beans. Doesn't fit a phone, so if you are looking for one to fit a phone, the Nathan 16oz can. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Hammonds

customer_reviews.title: Useful for long runs
customer_reviews.text: I’m training for a half marathon and this small water bottle is great for long runs. It doesn’t hold a lot of water, but enough to have a few sips every mile, and includes a pouch which is perfect for a snack.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this handheld bottle
customer_reviews.text: Love this handheld bottle. I typically don't like to run with anything in my hands, but this bottle fits on your hand like a glove so your not really carrying it, more like wearing it. Holds a good amount of water, good for short runs.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Updated strap is great!
customer_reviews.text: Due to the updated wrist strap, this bottle will stay in place. The older model would slide off the elastic at the top because there was not strap at the bottom. Have used on some training runs and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: T. Yung

customer_reviews.title: Small and simple
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent choice when it comes to running. It's small lightweight and allowed for easy access, even while in motion. If you live anywhere without easy access to water on your running route. I would recommend this set up.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Works well for short runs but leaks like nobody's business. I filled it up and left it on the counter for a minute and when I came back there was a pool of water on my counter. It leaks as I run, too. I've tried fussing with the cap and it still leaks. I don't really care so much because it still does the job, but I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: I love the little zip picket in the front
customer_reviews.text: I love the little zip picket in the front. It's just large enough for a gel, my keys and a bit of cash. The water bottle holds enough water for a medium-long run and doesn't leak, even with all the hand movement that goes along with running.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Best

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it .
customer_reviews.text: The one way silicone valve fell out .. and can’t be placed back in... so now it’s essentially a capless bottle
customer_reviews.author: juan carlos claros

product_meta.title: Nathan Quick Shot Plus Handheld Hydration Pack
product_meta.description: Details Includes 10 oz Super-Flex Flask with Race Cap Zipper 4.0" H x 3.25" W pocket for gels, keys or other small essentials Moisture-wicking, velcro-adjustable Wall Mesh hand strap with soft perimeter binding Unique hand strap eliminates the need to grip the Flask and offers alternative hand positions Rugged collar securely holds Flask and prevents hand strap from loosening Reflective detail for increased safety Flask Details Easy-squeeze 10 oz Nathan Super-Flex Flask Race Cap nozzle is always open but doesn't leak Delivers high flow rate of liquid with little effort BPA-free and won't leech plastic taste Bottle and cap are dishwasher safe on top rack
feature_bullets: 10 oz/300 ml Flask with race cap offers quick burst of fluid for short distances
Keep hands relaxed with adjustable hand strap and thumbhole
Expandable zippered pocket offers a surprising amount of storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
